The OSCAR working group has released a new version of the Open Source Cluster Application Resources (OSCAR) toolkit, OSCAR 6.0.6.

OSCAR is a software package that supports the use of high-performance computing by reducing the work of cluster configuration, installation, operation, and management. OSCAR-6.0.6 mainly includes bug fixes that were affecting OSCAR-6.0.

OSCAR 6.0.6 has been tested for use with both x86 processors and x86_64 processors under Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.0 and clone Linux distributions. OSCAR-6.0.6 also provides a support of Debian support on both x86 and x86_64 architectures, including Debian 4 and Ubuntu 8.04, 9.04. Debian 5 is supported only on x86_64 platforms.

OSCAR-6.0.x version is not necessarily suitable for production. OSCAR-6.0.x is actually very similar to KDE-4.0: this version is not necessarily "designed" for the users who need all the capabilities traditionally shipped with OSCAR, but this is a good new framework to include and develop new capabilities and move forward.

OSCAR 6.0.6, previous OSCAR versions, and additional information about the OSCAR project are available from the OSCAR web site: http://oscar.openclustergroup.org/

The OSCAR working group is a consortium of industry, academic and research participants. Organizations who contributed to OSCAR 6.0.6 include Revolution Linux, Bald Guy Software, Michael Smith Genome Sciences Centre, NEC HPC Europe, IBM, Intel, Indiana University, Louisiana Tech University, Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL), the University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio, the Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et en Automatique (INRIA), and KerLabs. OSCAR is the product of the OSCAR working group of the Open Cluster Group (OCG). OCG is dedicated to making cluster computing practical. The OCG and its subgroups are open to all.
